jsky.util
Class Logger

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--jsky.util.Logger
public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object

Logger provides an interface for handling logging messages. The purpose is to isolate the use of and changes to log4j as it quickly evolves.

Since log4j is primarily configured via a configuration file, the interface for Logger is quite simple. The configure() routine assumes the property file PropertyConfigurator rather than one of the XML-based configuration files.

The default log4j configuration file to use may be overridden by defining the system property jsky.util.logger.config to the name of the new config file before this class is accessed. Otherwise, the configure() method may be called at any time to set a new config file.
